subject: Sales
title: The One-Page Proposal
description: A fast breakdown of The One-Page Proposal for builders.

hook.text: A one-page proposal beat a fifty-page rival in a competitive bid. The buyer praised its clarity.

buildup.text: Long proposals signal insecurity. Buyers want answers quickly, not proof that you can write a novel.

discovery.text: Strong proposals cover four things: the problem, the solution, the timeline, and the investment.

twist.text: Sellers pad proposals to justify pricing. Buyers skim them anyway. Key information drowns in the bulk.

climax.text: Force everything onto one page. If it can't be explained clearly on one page, it's not clear enough.

punchline.text: If it doesn't fit on one page, it's not clear enough.

quiz.question: What should a strong one-page proposal include?
